meanings.definition: A condition of the eye in which the lens loses its ability to focus, making it difficult to see objects up close.
meanings.sent1: Presbyopia can make reading small print challenging for older individuals.
meanings.sent2: As people age, presbyopia often becomes noticeable when they struggle to read menus in dim lighting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnome blamed his inability to find his glasses on presbyopia, claiming they must have been hidden by mischievous fairies.
meanings.sent4: The foggy window seemed to suffer from presbyopia, struggling to focus on the bustling street outside.
meanings.sent5: Presbyopia acts like a sneaky thief, stealing the clarity of close-up vision over time.
